src.MachineLearningModel namespace

Submodules

src.MachineLearningModel.PokemonIdentifier module

src.MachineLearningModel.PokemonIdentifier.parse_filename(filename)[source]

Parses the filename to extract metadata.

Parameters:

filename (str) – The name of the image file.

Returns:

Name of Pokemon shiny_form (int): 1 if Pokemon is shiny, 0 if Pokemon is Normal gender (str): Gender of Pokemon

Return type:

pokemon_name (str)

src.MachineLearningModel.PokemonIdentifier.plot_training_history(history)[source]

Plots the training and validation accuracy for different outputs and the learning rate over epochs.

Parameters: history (keras.callbacks.History): A History object returned by the fit method of a Keras model.

It contains the training and validation metrics for each epoch.

The function will plot: - Training and validation accuracy for ‘name_output’, ‘shiny_output’, and ‘gender_output’. - Learning rate over epochs if ‘learning_rate’ is present in the history.

Returns: None

src.MachineLearningModel.PokemonIdentifier.predict_from_image(filepath, model, img_size, class_names, gender_labels)[source]

Predicts the Pokémon name, shiny status, and gender from an image, and visualizes preprocessing.

Parameters:

  • filepath (str) – Path to the image file.

  • model (tf.keras.Model) – Trained model for predictions.

  • img_size (tuple) – Image size expected by the model (height, width).

  • class_names (list) – List of Pokémon names corresponding to indices.

  • gender_labels (list) – List of gender labels corresponding to indices.

Returns:

Prediction results containing name, shiny status, and gender.

Return type:

dict

src.MachineLearningModel.PokemonIdentifier.preprocess_images(filepaths, labels, batch_size)[source]

Preprocesses images and labels for a machine learning model.

This function creates a TensorFlow dataset from a list of image file paths and corresponding labels. It loads each image, resizes it with padding, normalizes pixel values, and structures the labels into a dictionary format suitable for model outputs.

Parameters:

  • filepaths (list of str) – List of file paths to the images.

  • labels (list of tuples) – List of tuples where each tuple contains three elements: - name_output (int): The label for the name output. - shiny_output (int): The label for the shiny output. - gender_output (int): The label for the gender output.

  • batch_size (int) – The size of the batches to be generated.

Returns:

A TensorFlow dataset yielding batches of images and corresponding label dictionaries.

Return type:

tf.data.Dataset

src.MachineLearningModel.PokemonIdentifier.unzip_folder(folder_path, zip_file_name, extract_to=None)[source]

Unzips a .zip file in the given folder and deletes the .zip file afterwards.

folder_path: Path to the folder containing the .zip file. zip_file_name: Name of the .zip file (with extension). extract_to: Path to extract the contents to (default: same as folder_path).

src.MachineLearningModel.PokemonIdentifier.visualize_preprocessed_images(dataset, num_images=5)[source]

Visualizes a few random preprocessed images from the dataset.

Parameters:

  • dataset – A TensorFlow Dataset object containing preprocessed images and labels.

  • num_images – Number of images to visualize.
